item.title: Specialization: Time Series Analysis and its Models (Classic, Machine, Deep)
item.description: “Time is gold. It is our most valuable asset.” “Thus, understanding things that involves time will be rewarding, may be as a person or as a business man." In this post, I will be sharing my two years of search about Time Series, and how we must deal with it. First, let us define Time Series. According to Investopedia.com, “A time series is a sequence of data points that occur in successive order over some period of time.

item.title: Review: Forecasting Competition
Project 3: Seeing into the Future
item.description: Hi! It’s my birthday today. Thank you for passing by! Without further ado, let’s start seeing my future! Nah! I’m just fooling around. Now, let us become serious, here is an approach to a financial time series data. What to expect in project? In this project, I’ll try to analyze the effect of events when in a weekly transaction dataset. Expect visualizations that involves: 1. Autocorrelations and PACF 2. Transformations (Log and Standard) 3.

item.title: Project 2: Product Pricing Prediction Algorithm with XGBoost
item.description: Problem Statement The R&D department needs assistance in coming up with new product concepts and pricing based on the current product line. Solution Summary The following are some of the product gaps we’ve found in the current line of products. Aluminum Over Mountain Aluminum Triathalon To estimate the price of new bicycle models based on the current fleet. A pricing model using predictive analytics is developed. This keeps the price of new models in line with those of similar models in the marketplace.

item.title: Project 1: Customer Segmentation
item.description: Problem Statement: A marketing department wishes to boost email campaign engagement by grouping or segmenting customers based on their purchasing behaviors. Solution Summary Four distinct customer segments have been identified using K-means clustering and UMAP 2D Projection. The four customer segments were described using the customer’s most recent product purchases. Segment 1 Preferences: Road Bikes, Below $3200 (Economical Models) Segment 2 Preferences: Mountain Bikes, Above $3200 (Premium Models) Segment 3 Preferences: Road Bikes, Above $3200 (Premium Models) Segment 4 Preferences: Both Road and Mountain, Below $3200 (Economical Models) Customer Preferences
